headline: Cherry Blueberry Pie
description: Cherry-blueberry pie is a fruity and delicious dessert that goes beyond the usual pie in a double-crusted treat that uses an easy-to-follow recipe.
name: Cherry Blueberry Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Press one of the pie crusts into a 9-inch pie plate. Stir together 1/2 cup sugar, cornstarch, and cinnamon in a large bowl. Stir in cherry pie filling and blueberries. Spoon into pie crust. Top with second crust and press the edges to seal. Flute edges or press with the tines of a fork. Whisk together egg white and water in a cup with a fork. Brush over the top of the pie, then sprinkle with 2 teaspoons sugar.

Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 45 to 55 minutes. Cover the edges of the crust with aluminum foil if they appear to be getting too dark. Cool for at least 2 hours to allow the filling to set before serving.

review.reviewBody: Absolute family favorite for many years now. I won't change a thing about it!
absolutely delightful! Have made this many times and neighbors ask for it. Easy to make and always a treat!
Delicious!
GREAT!!!!!

Fruit is in season so I used 2-1/2 cups each of blueberries and cherries. Prebaked the bottom crust. Baked pie at 350 degrees for 40-45 min. I have a large diameter rigid plastic straw which I think came with a slurpee from 7-11 which is great for removing cherry pits.

My husband and I needed a quick sugar fix and this pie hit the spot. We happened to Already have all the ingredients at home. I’d like for it to be a tad less sweet—even wondering about adding blobs of cream cheese Husband said he never knew pie was so easy to make. Hah! I didn’t bother telling him about my years of disasters!
I used half sugar half stevia to make it more diabetic friendly and frozen cherries to make my own pie filling. It is delicious
i've made this several times and it is great each time.
Thanks April! Would have never guessed what an amazing combo cherry and blueberry make. My new favorite fruit pie. Perfect with Perfect Pie Crust II recipe from this site

Excellent recipe, and I tweaked it a bit by adding fresh strawberries and rhubarb.

We love Rhubarb, so why not & it was perfect with some fresh homemade whipped cream
I made this pie using the French pastry crust and a crumble topping instead of a second pastry crust. It turned out fantastic! I will definitely make this again.
Didn’t put crust on top. It was so delicious.
Perfect pie! Just the right amount of sweet and tart
One of my go to pies. Easy and very yummy, and I usually always have the ingredients on hand.

I usually don't make pies, I can bake cakes, but pies are a bit difficult for me. They either spill over in the oven or get very soggy . Made this last weekend. The family loved it. Great idea to mix canned and fresh /frozen fruit. Will be making this again. Will experiment further with combinations of fruit. Thank you for making me a pie baker.
Quick easy and delicious all will minimal ingredients.
I love this pie. I take it to family and work functions.

So easy and delicious! Quick to put together. Baked for 45 minutes at 375. I can keep these ingredients on hand and 
it'd be simple to put together whenever needed.
the pie turned out wonderful. i forgot to take a picture thou.made it and ate it all up before i could even think of doing anything else
Recipe needed more corn starch. 1/4 cup would be recommended. Baked for 45 minutes and crust was done @425. A homemade crust would have made this pie exceptional.

Made it with no changes
Used wild blueberries
Really good and will make it again
Unable to paste my photo
Really nice mix of cherry & blueberry flavors. But make sure to make plenty of small holes for the steam to release.

Wanted to use up canned cherry pie filling which I hate because it tastes like the can. This recipe was wonderful. The only change I made was to add 1/4 tsp of almond flavoring. We loved this pie. Neither one of us could tell that there was even cherry pie filling in it!

I used part cherries and frozen whole cranberries. What a wonderful combination. I mostly followed the ingredient list. I thickened the cherry juice first, added sugar to make 3/4 cups, added cranberries and cooked until jam-like and added cherries and cooked slightly longer,and filled unbaked pie crust. It was the star of our Christmas dinner.
This pie is my most-requested recipe! I have made my own cherry pie filling in the past because I had the cherries on hand, but it's just as tasty with canned pie filling. Everyone loves it!

Love love love this easy pie! This has quickly become our favorite pie, it is fruity without being too tart or too sweet. Our extended family always asks for it at holidays and I even get requests for birthdays!
Fantastic recipe that got me first place in overall desserts. I highly recommend this, but I don't think it needs to go in the oven for that long. 35 minutes may be better.
I thought this was good, may have been even better with fresh Cherries. Everyone loved it.
This is my favorite pie recipe. Works well with frozen Boysenberries too! Tastes just as good if not better the next day.

Wonderful tasting and beautiful to look at. My families new favorite. I did add a drained can of tart cherries since canned pie filling usually is a little shy on the fruit and generous with the "filling".
A nice combination of flavors, but didn't "wow".

Very good but, needs more filling than recipe makes. I also didn't like the pre-made pie crust but I will use this filling recipe again for sure. I think if it was doubled it might fill a 9in deep dish pie crust correctly, although doubling it may be what is required just to fill the normal 9in pie crust correctly. Thanks for sharing. It is great to have a filling that is perfect...not too runny and not too thick.
Was super easy and a huge hit!

I didn't use the blueberries, just the cherry pie filling. I don't understand why it needs cornstarch. It made the filling very gluey & dense. The flavor was good though. I had to modify the cooking time & temp so the crust wouldn't burn. If you don't have a crust ring for the edges foil works well enough.

Great, easy pie. Maybe it's just me, but I was expecting a bit more "WOW!" after all the rave reviews. Don't get me wrong, it's a really good pie, but not memorable. Still, if you're considering this, give it a go. METHOD: Aside from using my own pie crust, I followed the directions as written. I used Comstock cherry pie filling and a half good quality frozen blueberries and half fresh blueberries. WOULD I MAKE IT AGAIN? Yes, but will increase the amount of pie-filling as my taste buds begged for more punch. I will also use Morello Cherries in a jar from Trader Joe's. Perhaps with those minor changes, I'd give it a "5".
Other than using one pint of fresh blueberries instead of frozen, I made this recipe as is. Delicious! I will definitely make again.
Super easy and way good! I'm not much of a pie person, especially cherry.. The boyfriend requested cherry pie and it was gone by the next day, even I loved it!
this pie was amazing
I made this pie exactly as it was given and it looked great, I thought it was way to sweet thoughand the cherry pie filling totally covered up the taste of the blueberries.

This recipe is perfect! Do not attempt to add more blueberries or it will ruin the recipe. To prevent the edges from burning I put foil around the edges for the full time I cook the pie. Also, do not put egg whites on the edges or the foil will stick to the crust and will completely pull off the edges when you remove the foil. It is perfect by 40 mins with no burning of edges. If you still find that your edges and pie are burning after using the foil turn your oven down to 400 degrees. I've used this recipe for years and always get fabulous reviews! Even cherry pie haters LOVE this pie and always ask for the recipe.
OMG soooo delicious! I didnt change a thing!! I normally dont like pie or especially cherry pie, but this was perfect!!
This is a great pie!
My whole family thinks this is the best pie ever!
Would have added more blueberries, but there's always next time
This is my new favorite pie. I can't believe how delicious it is and how easy to make! Thank you for such a wonderful addition to my recipe box and my hips. :)

I have made this recipe twice. I used the pre-made pie crust from the freezer section and topped with the pie crust from the refrigerator section. The second time I used aluminum foil on the crust by cutting into strips. The foil stuck to the pie ugh. Next time I will use no stick foil.
Delicious! Loved the combination. A great fruit pie!

I've made this a lot and it always gets rave reviews. I add cinnamon and nutmeg, and instead of blueberries I add frozen mix berries (raspberries, blueberries, blackberries). You can substitute the cornstarch for flour (works great!). The cornstarch amount in this recipe makes it a thick gel pie, so, be mindful of that.
This is a truly wonderful pie. I followed the recipe to a "T" and it turned out exactly as expected. Try this one. You won't be disappointed!
Tastes pretty good, spilled over a tiny bit, though. I added about a 1/4 tsp of almond extract. Don't keep the temperature that high the entire time; I brought it down to 350 after about 15 minutes
Probably one of our favorite pies! We had hunters hunting on a cold day and invited them in for this. Loved it!
This pie is very simple. It's easy to make and delicious. It's great for the summer with all the fresh flavors.
Awesome. Our new favorite pie.

This is really so good. I am chuckling as I write this because I'm really not a pie person and I'm especially not a fruit pie person but I had some canned cherries close to expiration and some blueberries in the fridge. Anyway...BRAVO--such a simple and yummy pie.

This recipe rocks!! I don't usually comment on recipes when I haven't cooked them, at least once, according to the directions. But after reading the recipe and the reviews, I knew this was a winner and would work with my new 'goal'. I've made myself a pledge to only purchase absolute necessities until I empty my pantry and freezer -- before I start putting up and preserving new things. Even though I had to finagle things, it came out soooo good!
I used the pie filling and 3.5 cups of blueberries as well as a can of well drained, tart cherries. I added a splash of lemon and sugar/stevia blend. I pre-baked the bottom crust at 425 for 12 min. then let it cool. I only had about 2/3 of a top crust as I had previously invaded my stash. So I used cookie cutters to cut out rabbit and egg shapes to decorate my Easter dessert. I topped them with colored sugar. Since my pie was deep dish I got most of the filling in but I goofed and forgot to add the cornstarch . . .oh well. I froze the leftover filling to add to coffee cake.
I shielded the crust and baked it at 425 for 10 minutes and then cut it down to 350 for the rest of the time.
Was it a little runny? Yep- my fault. It was still delicious!
Now, one question. Hopefully no one is using strips of foil to shield their crust? It's a lot easier to cut a foil circle 1 in. larger than the pan, fold it into quarters and cut out the center. You end up with a hoop shape that you just drop on and tuck under.
THANK YOU April!!
I made this today with Hot Water Pie Crust II recipe from this site and it was superb. Followed the recipe except baked it at 350 for 60 minutes. Not too tart or too sweet. Perfect.
This was delicious, just the right amount of sweet and tangy! Followed recipe exactly.

Great pie! I made my own cherry pie filling from Ranier cherries I vacuum froze this summer when they were in season...also used my own vacuum frozen blueberries. Might as well make a double recipe...You will want more.

I'm not a big fan of cherry pie, so I was hesitant to try this but it was very tasty and came out beautifully! However, I did not follow the recipe 100%. First off, I used fresh blueberries (if you have access to fresh blueberries, use them instead!) - also, I baked at 425 for 15 minutes, then 350 for the rest (35-45 minutes). Do NOT bake the pie at the high temperature for the entire time. Make sure to cover the edges of the crust with aluminum foil to avoid burning (remove during last 10-15 minutes of baking), and place a cookie sheet under the pie for spillage (I used a normal 9" pie dish and only a few droplets overflowed). The pie came out beautifully and was a total hit!
Amazing. Easy. And Delicious.

Delicious!!!!!!!!!! My family loved it!!! I omitted the cinnamon-they are not fans of it, and doubled the filling.
A new tradition for us!!!
I do not even like fruit pies but I would eat this one again and again. It's the best fruit pie I've ever made or had.

I am only giving this four stars since I would have added more corn starch. I did increase the blueberries to two cups so I should have thought to add additional corn starch as well. I made this the day before my dinner and it was still too runny, but tasted fabulous.
Best. Pie. Ever.
I agree with those who doubled the filling recipe and used a deep dish pie pan. You will still have about one cup of filling leftover but the pie will be really juicy!

There is a reason you don't see anything less than 5 stars on all the reviews -- this pie ROCKS! I'm not a huge fan of just blueberry pie or cherry pie, but together, this really was delicious. And I say "was" because the pie didn't make it through the morning. And it was just my daughter and me eating it!

I followed everything as originally described with just a couple of embelishments, as others suggested. First, I chilled fresh blueberries in the freezer for about an hour. This supposedly holds in the blueberry flavor more so than fresh, mushy blueberries. I also made it 2 cups instead of 1 1/2. Second, I used the cherry pie filling as described, but I added about 3/4 cub of fresh, chilled, pitted cherries to the mix. I had them, why not use them? Third, I used the pre-made rolled pie crusts. That was for me very easy and doable. Lastly, I did let the pie cool for exactly two hours, but I think a little less time is fine; it was barely lukewarm by then.

All-in-all, a great, EASY recipe. I'll be making this again for sure. And I loved the fresh cherries. That had a deeper, less tart flavor than the canned cherries.
Easy and delicious; a different take on fruit pie! Only took 30 minutes to bake in my convection oven, browned beautifully with egg wash.
THIS RECIPE ROCKS! So easy and I always get rave reviews on this pie when I make it!

I made this for Mother's Day exactly as written. My family loved it, even my brother who usually never eats dessert had 2 pieces! That was when I knew it was a keeper. And the fact that it was sooo easy was just icing on the cake..or should I say PIE! Yum Yum

My husband and father in law love pie. I'm not big on it but I found this recipe by mistake and thought that i would chance it. It's AMAZING!! We all love it. It is sweet and tart and super easy to make. I use fresh blueberries instead of frozen and I put about a cup or so extra into the filling batch, just so that it's really full. I can't say enough good things about this pie!
This is the best!! My fiance who doesn't usually like berry pies loves this recipe. I make it exactly the way the recipes says and it comes out so perfect.
I tried this in the summer. So easy and everyone loved it. I needed to leave feedback because I just looked it up again to make for our Christmas buffet.
I'm so excited that I have this recipe! I've made this pie six times and have been told by multiple people that it's the best pie they've ever had!
Great, easy recipe. I used cherry pie filling sweetened with Splenda, which gave it a very fruity taste without too much sweetness.
My husband loves cherry pie. However, I wasn't expecting him to say it was the best cherry pie he had ever had!
This pie was OUT OF THIS WORLD! I made it for Thanksgiving and everyone loved it. Thank you for posting the recipe. I will definitely make this again and again.

I may have been helped in knowing to leave some extra room for the filling to bubble. I filled it too high. My lattice work wasn't very pretty after the bubble over, but it made up for that lack in taste. Yum!
This was okay. Might try again with fresh cherries instead of the filling. Made with the cream cheese crust recipe on this website.
I started out making cherry pie but ran out of cherries so I added some blueberries I had on hand. The result was one scrumptious pie! What a delicious accident!

Last time I baked a pie was in the 90's. Not very good at it. I made this yesterday, at husband's request, and it turned out perfect. It was so delicious. I think I'll tackle a pumkin pie from this website for Thanksgiving. Thank you for giving me a boost of confidence.

This was good, and better than the average cherry pie. I love the depth the cinnamon gives to it (I added more than the recipe called for b/c we love it in everything). I also zested some lemon into the filling mix, which my husband really liked. I think next time though I would add a little more cornstarch. It's not runny or anything, just a personal preference.
I cheated, but basically the same concept. I used 1 can of cherry pie filling and one can of blueberry pie filling. I added more cinnamon. I also made my own crust using this recipe from here
My inlaws loved it! Great blend of cherry and blueberries.
This was awesome. Now that fall has arrived, I can't wait to make it again.
Yum! I added a little lemon zest and a little lemon juice. Perfect, our new fav!!!

This is a great recipe. I have made Blueberry as well as Cherry before and always suspected something was missing. Cinnamon. This came out perfect but I want to add that I did make one change. I used fresh blueberries but I froze them first. Besides that followed everything exact and it came out great. In fact, besides my apple pie this is the best pie I've made to date. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

I used fresh blueberries, but otherwise followed the recipe exactly and it turned out perfect! 
I did cover my crust with foil for the first 30 min. then took it off for the last 10. Mine only needed 40 minutes and it was beautifully golden brown. I put cool whip on top and it was a huge hit with my hubby!!!! Perfect for the 4th of JULY!

I can see why this has 5 stars! It is so quick and tastes awesome! I did adjust the temperature to 375 and baked for about 45 minutes. 425 is way too hot and will burn the crust. Which happened the first time I baked it. Second time at 375 was perfect. Thanks for submitting!

This pie has a really nice flavor and wasn't too tart or too sweet. The whole family loved it! I made the crust from scratch using my favorite recipe from here: "Ruth's Grandma's Pie Crust" but otherwise followed the recipe as written. Fantastic!!

To repeat everyone else, this recipe was a hit at the graduation party I went to and it was so easy to make. The only thing I would do differently is add more blueberries to this pie next time I make.
Everybody loved it!! Very easy and tasty!
This is the easiest and best pie I have ever made. My husband and I ate the whole thing at two meals. We hid it in the frig from our children! I'm making it for the second time this week.
This turned out soooo good!!! I used 2 cups of frozen wild blueberries and put a pie shield on the crust after 15 minutes of baking. Other than that I followed to recipe as is. Tasty, delicious pie!

fun, easy, delicious! for the recent reviewer that had trouble with burning....I always take strips of aluminum foil and fold over and under the edge of the crust...take it off for the last 15 minutes....old trick!
Added more fruit and a 1/4 tsp of almond extract otherwise followed the recipe ~ an instant favorite at our house. Thank you!
This was pretty good. My filling was a tad runny though... I was thinking maybe it was because I didn't let the blueberries thaw enough before using?
I loved this! I Doubled the berries adding Huckleberries along with the Blueberries and a 1/4 t. of Almond Extract - put in a deep dish, 9" pan - mmmmmm !!!
Really?? Baked 15 minutes LESS than recommended, and burnt to a black crisp! Horrible recipe.
This pie is easy and delicious. I also have made it using mixed frozen berries (not just blueberries). My boyfriend actually likes the mixed berries better. I like both ways.
